Salted Caramel Sauce
200g sugar
200ml cups heavy cream
20g butter
2.5g coarse sea salt
  1. Add the sugar to a saucepan. A larger pan is better, as is one that has a light color so you can see how brown the caramel is getting
  2. Heat at medium, until the sugar starts to color
  3. Meanwhile, warm the cream in a separate pan until steam starts coming off, then set aside
  4. Gently ue a wooden spoon or tip the pan to encourage it to mix and color evenly (Don't worry if it goes pebbly/lumpy/weird - as long as it doesn't burn, just keep it on medium and it will be fine in the end)
  5. Keep going until the sugar turns rich reddish brown, then immediately take it off the heat and very slowly add the cream while stirring
  6. Adding the cream slowly will stop chunks of caramel solidifying, which then take ages to melt again. So patience pays off here, and it's quicker in the end
  7. Stir in the butter and salt, and leave to cool
Footer. Not much here really. Nice to have a footer though.
